props.label: html 42
props.content:
Council Tax Reduction Online Application Form

You can claim Council Tax Reduction or Second Adult Rebate using this form.

If you are a tenant of East Ayrshire Council or of a Registered Social Landlord and are subject to an under occupancy charge (sometimes referred to as the bedroom tax) we will also treat this as a claim for Discretionary Housing Payment to cover the under occupancy charge.

The form has been designed to be easy to complete. The form will help and guide you as you work through it, to ensure that you only fill in the parts that you need to. This makes it much quicker and easier to complete than a paper form.

If you need help you can contact the Revenues and Benefits Section by phone on 01563 554400 (option 3) or by email at benefits@east-ayrshire.gov.uk

If your circumstances change you must tell us straight away. You can do this by completing our online Change of Circumstances form. We will adjust your claim and make sure you are receiving the benefit you are entitled to. It will also avoid any Council Tax Reduction overpayments which affecting the monthly payments due to your Council Tax account.

Evidence Required

You must submit evidence of all your income you have detailed on the application form. You can do this online using the link to PostBox on the email confirmation you will receive when you submit your claim.

If you cannot get the evidence we need straight away do not worry. Submit the form and provide your evidence within 10 days. If you do not submit the form straight away, you may lose money. If you cannot get the evidence within 10 days, let us know. We may be able to help you. We will usually pay your Council Tax Reduction, the Monday after the date of claim.

Examples of Evidence Required (check which evidence is required)

  • Universal Credit – Please provide evidence of your most recent assessment period from your journal. This must show the breakdown of your assessment, including any deductions made from your entitlement. We can accept screenshots from your online journal.
  • All other Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) benefits – Please provide the most recent award letter from the DWP which details your current entitlement for each of the benefits
  • Earned income – Please provide your last 5 weekly, 3 fortnightly or 2 monthly consecutive payslips.
  • Capital – Please provide a current statement showing at least 2 months of transactions
  • Student Income – Please provide your latest student loan/bursary/grant award letter (s)
  • Childcare Costs – Please provide your contract from your childcare provider showing their registration number.
  • Other Capital – Please provide your share certificate, premium bonds, national savings certificates and current valuation letters for unit trusts.

props.label: html 44
props.content:
How we collect and use information

We will use the information you give in this form, and in any supporting evidence you send us, to process your claim for Council Tax Reduction.

We may pass the information to other agencies or organisations such as the Department for Work and Pensions and HMRC, as allowed by law. East Ayrshire Council may use the information contained in this form to see if you are entitled to free school meals and school clothing grants. We may check information you have provided, or information about you that someone else has provided, with other information held by us. We may also get information about you from certain third parties, or give them information to:

  • make sure the information is accurate
  • prevent or detect crime and
  • protect public funds.

These third parties include government departments, local authorities and private-sector companies such as Experian, a Credit Reference Agency, banks and organisations that may lend you money.

We will not give information about you to anyone else, or use information about you for other purposes, unless the law allows us to.

props.label: staticText 6
props.content:
Have you or your partner or any children you are claiming for, have any money coming in (or expect to have some money coming in) that you have not already told us about on this form?

This includes maintenance or child support for you, your partner or any other children you have not told us about on this form, money from a trust fund, training allowances, a student grant or loan, and any cash payments. Also tell us about any money you get from people living in your house as boarders, lodgers or subtenants. You do not need to tell us about payments from the Independent Living Fund, the Eileen Trust or the MacFarlane Trust

props.label: staticText 3
props.content:
I declare that the information I have given on this form is correct and complete.


I understand that if I give information that is incorrect or incomplete, you may take action against me. This may include court action. 


I agree that you will use the information I have provided to process my change and you may check some of the information with other sources as allowed by law.


I understand that you may use any information I have provided in connection with this and any other claim for social security benefits or educational benefits that I have made or may make. You may give some information to other organisations, such as government departments and other local authorities.


I agree that you may use the information I have provided in connection with the collection of Council Tax, or any other debt to the Council. 


I understand that the data held by you will be used for cross-system and cross-authority comparison purposes for the prevention and detection of fraud. The information may be passed to the DWP or other government organisations for this purpose.


I know that I must let you know about any changes in circumstances that might affect my claim, otherwise I will have to pay back all money overpaid to me.

props.label: html 2
props.content:
Please see below to find out what evidence you will need to send.

Please do not send valuable items through the post, if you can, bring them into the Customer Service Centre or any Local Office. If you cannot get into the office, phone us for more advice.

If you do not provide all the evidence we need, we will not be able to pay you any benefit. We need the same evidence for your partner, if you have one.

If you cannot provide the evidence straight away, submit the form and send the evidence within 7 days. We can start to process your claim, but we will not be able to pay you any benefit until we have all the evidence.
